Metadata.Title: The Cardholder Data Environment Doesn't Have Direct Internet Access
Metadata.DirectLink: The Cardholder Data Environment Doesn't Have Direct Internet Access
Metadata.Author: Serge Batchilo, Jason Taylor, Joe Basirico

Content.Data:
Applies to

  • PCI DSS Requirement 1.3.3

What to Check For

The cardholder data environment should not have direct Internet access. Neither outbound nor inbound traffic should be routable between the cardholder data environment and the Internet.

Why

Denying the cardholder data environment Internet connectivity prevents the potential attacker from being able to conduct attacks against it.

How to Check

Check the router and firewall configurations to make sure there are no port-forwarding rules or gateways that allow inbound connections directly to the cardholder data environment. Use built-in operating system tools (such as ping, traceroute, nslookup) to make sure that the cardholder data environment has no Internet access.

How to Fix

Remove any routes from the router configuration that allow Internet access to the cardholder data environment. Remove any port forwarding rules from the firewalls and/or routers that allow Internet access to the cardholder data environment. Repeat the How to Check processes to ensure that changes have not accidentally introduced Internet connectivity in the cardholder environment.
